Posts.Content: Mercury wrote: Hi everyone: You are all wonderful women and I've been helped so much by reading the posts here.  My Mom who is 73, has recently been diagnosed with Stage 3, ILC, 6.2cm tumor, ER+PR+ HER2 Equivocal, 2/2 nodes negative after Sentinel Biopsy.  We are waiting for the Onco scores to come back.    If the Cancer is in the Onco score aggressive range the Dr. is recommending Rt Breast Masc, followed by Chemo/Targeted therapy and then followed by Hormones If the Cancer is in the nonagressive range the Dr. is recommending Arimax for a few months to shrink the tumor, then lumpectomy followed by Chemo/Targeted therapy and then followed by Hormones. The scenario where neoadjuvant chemo to shrink tumor prior to surgery has not been included as an option and I've read this is a very positive thing especially if surgery now would not be able to obtain clean margins.  We are obtaining our second opinion from Hopkins, and we do have complete trust in this oncologist, but right now my Dad would be mad if I went and asked the doctor these questions so I'm wondering if any of you have an idea why this my not have been discussed as a scenario? Thanks so much for your assistance!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Kind regards, Mercury.  Log in to post a reply
